results.title: Kip and David. Episode 09
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David visit ‘Lamington National Park’ set high in the mountains. They see the rain forest with its giant trees, creepers, mosses and lichens, waterfalls and pools. They float leaf-boats down the small waterfalls, find a satin bower-bird’s playground and inspect the strange assortment of blue objects in it. Finally, they feed the wild scrub turkeys, bower birds, wild parrots and other small birds. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 08
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is David’s birthday and Kip is the first to greet him, playing ‘Happy Birthday’ on his pipes. David is given a small microscope and some boxes of prepared slides. They look at some of these and then find things in the garden to inspect under the microscope. The postman brings another parcel, which contains an irrepressible Jack-in-the-Box. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 06
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Kip and David”.
David is called by his elfin friend Kip to look at a fascinating spiky caterpillar. They watch as it spins its cup-shaped cocoon and observe a spider forming its web to trap unwary insects. They build a cage for the cocoon and later see the newly emerged moth. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 05
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Kip and David”.
David and his elfin friend work together on Kip’s tree house, using a framework of branches, thatching it with banana leaves and leaving spaces for a doorway and window. Finally, they build a rock garden, and place ‘Kip’s House’ above the entrance. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 01
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Kip and David”.
David, a young boy, goes by boat to Stradbroke Island on a holiday. As he collects Banksia cones in the bush, he hears honey-eaters followed by piping music played by a friendly elf. Together they explore the caves along the coast. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A thirteen part children’s adventure series made by Arthur and Corinne Cantrill about a young boy called David who meets a bushland elf while holidaying on Queensland’s Stradbroke Island and embarks on a series of adventures that highlight Australia’s wildlife and natural surroundings.

results.title: Kinship and descent. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Faces of culture”.
In many societies kinship and descent help serve the political, economic and religious functions that make societies work as a whole. This program covers tribesmen of Papua New Guinea who trace their descent back so far beyond human memory, that clans are descended from mythical ancestors. Compares patrilineal and matrilineal societies and shows how kinship and descent can solve problems of succession, inheritance and social order. Also contrasts modern western society. Narrated by David Carradine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston

results.title: Kings of sport
results.creator_credit: Arthur C. Stevens and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Introducing twenty five years of sporting champions, including; Henry Seagrove on land and water; Donald Campbell’s land speed record; John Cobb; TT Races on the Isle of Man; Fred Perry at Wimbledon; Henry Cotton the golfer; Denis Compton and Donald Bradman at cricket.

results.title: Kings and scribes
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer goes in search of the lost tomb of Herihor, emulating Howard Carter and his discovery of Tut’s tomb. He looks at the role of the scribe and in particular one man who collected the ancient coffins of pharoahs whose tombs had been plundered, and reburied them in order to safeguard them. When the plundered tombs were discovered, the Egyptians of the day, sang the funerary songs of their ancient counterparts as the pharoahs and their sarcophagi were taken down the Nile to a final resting place in the Musuem. The program also highlights recent archaeological investigations in the Valley of the Kings.

results.title: Kings and coolies
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Christine Olsen, AFFC and Olsen Levy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Riding the tiger”.
Riding the Tiger Series. Even though the Indonesians rid themselves of Dutch colonisers in 1949, the new economic order developed by the military has replicated the vastly unequal distribution of wealth that has plagued Indonesia’s modern history: now, however, the wealthy few are Indonesian not European. This episode examines Indonesia’s feudal past and the impact of European colonisation on the Indonesian population. The maintenance of feudal authority by the European colonisers is one of the roots, this video claims, of the military’s successful suppression of democracy in contemporary Indonesia.
